title: LA rock meets Scandi cool at Anine Bing's first Australian outpost
text:
Lauren Sams Luxury Editor Oct 10, 2019 — 10.49am Share

Born in Denmark, raised in Sweden and now living in Los Angeles … you’d be hard-pressed to find a woman with a cooler pedigree than Anine Bing. The former model and early adopter of blogging and social media launched her eponymous label seven years ago, fusing those elements of her background to create a line of clothes that combine Scandinavian restraint with LA rock’n’roll vibes: perfectly fitted white tees with louche leather pants, checked blazers over vintage-looking tees with denim.

Now, she is opening her 14th store – and the first in Australia – in Sydney’s Paddington.

“Australian customers have been very vocal about opening a store here,” says Bing, who is the brand’s chief creative officer. “We’ve had so many requests to open here – via social media and through customers who travel to our American and European stores. It was a natural fit.”

Timeless style with a rock 'n' roll edge, is how the brand describes its feel. Supplied

Australian style, says Bing, has many parallels to those of Scandinavia and Los Angeles. “It’s very relaxed, with a touch of rock. Our aesthetic works very well here.”

What’s more, adds chief operating officer Annika Meller: “Australian women have embraced Anine Bing since the very beginning. Since launch, Australia has been a top five market for us via e-commerce.”

Opening a brick-and-mortar store, too, is an opportunity for Bing and Meller to understand the Australian consumer better. The brand began as a direct-to-consumer line and used social media such as Instagram to act as word of mouth, but Bing quickly saw the value in opening stores, despite the high costs.

I want to make things easy for women on the go. — Anine Bing

“It happened very organically,” she says. “Early on women wanted to come into our showroom, to touch the clothes, feel them, try them on. So we realised from the beginning there was space to open a store.”

Two years after launch, the brand opened its first store, in Los Angeles, followed by New York and then Paris. There are now 14 stores worldwide, with five alone opening this year.
description: After amassing an fan base Down Under via e-commerce, the Los Angeles-based designer is opening a store in Sydney.
